00029 ## Removes self for the hash d
00030 # @param    d   Hash to remove self from
00031 # @returns d with hash removed.
00032 def _del_self(d):
00033     """
00034     Used to remove the self key from the dict d.  Self is included when calling
00035     the function locals() in a class method.
00036     """
00037     del d['self']
00038     return d
00039 
00040 
00041 def _check_search_key(search_key, supported_keys):
00042     if search_key and search_key not in supported_keys:
00043         raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.UNSUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEY,
00044                        "Unsupported search_key: '%s'" % search_key)
00045     return
00046 
00047 
00048 ## Descriptive exception about daemon not running.
00049 def _raise_no_daemon():
00050     raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.DAEMON_NOT_RUNNING,
00051                    "The libStorageMgmt daemon is not running (process "
00052                    "name lsmd), try 'service libstoragemgmt start'")
00053 
00054 
00055 ## Main client class for library.
00056 # ** IMPORTANT **
00057 # Theory of operation for methods in this class.
00058 # We are using the name of the method and the name of the parameters and
00059 # using python introspection abilities to translate them to the method and
00060 # parameter names.  Makes the code compact, but you will break things if the
00061 # IPlugin class does not match the method names and parameters here!
00062 class Client(INetworkAttachedStorage):
00063 
00064     ##
00065     # Used for default flag value
00066     #
00067     FLAG_RSVD = 0
00068 
00069     """
00070     Client side class used for managing storage that utilises RPC mechanism.
00071     """
00072     ## Method added so that the interface for the client RPC and the plug-in
00073     ## itself match.
00074     def plugin_register(self, uri, plain_text_password, timeout_ms, flags=0):
00075         raise RuntimeError("Do not call directly!")
00076 
00077     ## Called when we are ready to initialize the plug-in.
00078     # @param    self                    The this pointer
00079     # @param    uri                     The uniform resource identifier
00080     # @param    plain_text_password     Password as plain text
00081     # @param    timeout_ms              The timeout in ms
00082     # @param    flags                   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00083     # @returns None
00084     def __start(self, uri, password, timeout, flags=0):
00085         """
00086         Instruct the plug-in to get ready
00087         """
00088         self._tp.rpc('plugin_register', _del_self(locals()))
00089 
00090     ## Checks to see if any unix domain sockets exist in the base directory
00091     # and opens a socket to one to see if the server is actually there.
00092     # @param    self    The this pointer
00093     # @returns True if daemon appears to be present, else false.
00094     @staticmethod
00095     def _check_daemon_exists():
00096         uds_path = Client._plugin_uds_path()
00097         if os.path.exists(uds_path):
00098             for root, sub_folders, files in os.walk(uds_path):
00099                 for filename in files:
00100                     uds = os.path.join(root, filename)
00101 
00102                     try:
00103                         #This operation will work if the daemon is available
00104                         s = _TransPort.get_socket(uds)
00105                         s.close()
00106                         return True
00107                     except LsmError:
00108                         pass
00109         else:
00110             #Base directory is not present?
00111             pass
00112         return False
00113 
00114     @staticmethod
00115     def _plugin_uds_path():
00116         rc = _UDS_PATH
00117 
00118         if 'LSM_UDS_PATH' in os.environ:
00119             rc = os.environ['LSM_UDS_PATH']
00120 
00121         return rc
00122 
00123     ## Class constructor
00124     # @param    self                    The this pointer
00125     # @param    uri                     The uniform resource identifier
00126     # @param    plain_text_password     Password as plain text (Optional)
00127     # @param    timeout_ms              The timeout in ms
00128     # @param    flags                   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00129     # @returns None
00130     def __init__(self, uri, plain_text_password=None, timeout_ms=30000,
00131                  flags=0):
00132         self._uri = uri
00133         self._password = plain_text_password
00134         self._timeout = timeout_ms
00135         self._uds_path = Client._plugin_uds_path()
00136 
00137         u = uri_parse(uri, ['scheme'])
00138 
00139         scheme = u['scheme']
00140         if "+" in scheme:
00141             (plug, proto) = scheme.split("+")
00142             scheme = plug
00143 
00144         self.plugin_path = os.path.join(self._uds_path, scheme)
00145 
00146         if os.path.exists(self.plugin_path):
00147             self._tp = _TransPort(_TransPort.get_socket(self.plugin_path))
00148         else:
00149             #At this point we don't know if the user specified an incorrect
00150             #plug-in in the URI or the daemon isn't started.  We will check
00151             #the directory for other unix domain sockets.
00152             if Client._check_daemon_exists():
00153                 raise LsmError(ErrorNumber.PLUGIN_NOT_EXIST,
00154                                "Plug-in %s not found!" % self.plugin_path)
00155             else:
00156                 _raise_no_daemon()
00157 
00158         self.__start(uri, plain_text_password, timeout_ms, flags)
00159 
00160     ## Synonym for close.
00161     @_return_requires(None)
00162     def plugin_unregister(self, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00163         """
00164         Synonym for close.
00165         """
00166         self.close(flags)
00167 
00168     ## Does an orderly plugin_unregister of the plug-in
00169     # @param    self    The this pointer
00170     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00171     @_return_requires(None)
00172     def close(self, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00173         """
00174         Does an orderly plugin_unregister of the plug-in
00175         """
00176         self._tp.rpc('plugin_unregister', _del_self(locals()))
00177         self._tp.close()
00178         self._tp = None
00179 
00180     ## Retrieves all the available plug-ins
00181     @staticmethod
00182     @_return_requires([unicode])
00183     def available_plugins(field_sep=':', flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00184         """
00185         Retrieves all the available plug-ins
00186 
00187         Return list of strings of available plug-ins with the
00188         "desc<sep>version"
00189         """
00190         rc = []
00191 
00192         if not Client._check_daemon_exists():
00193             _raise_no_daemon()
00194 
00195         uds_path = Client._plugin_uds_path()
00196 
00197         for root, sub_folders, files in os.walk(uds_path):
00198             for filename in files:
00199                 uds = os.path.join(root, filename)
00200                 tp = _TransPort(_TransPort.get_socket(uds))
00201                 i, v = tp.rpc('plugin_info', dict(flags=Client.FLAG_RSVD))
00202                 rc.append("%s%s%s" % (i, field_sep, v))
00203                 tp.close()
00204 
00205         return rc
00206 
00207     ## Sets the timeout for the plug-in
00208     # @param    self    The this pointer
00209     # @param    ms      Time-out in ms
00210     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00211     @_return_requires(None)
00212     def time_out_set(self, ms, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00213         """
00214         Sets any time-outs for the plug-in (ms)
00215 
00216         Return None on success, else LsmError exception
00217         """
00218         return self._tp.rpc('time_out_set', _del_self(locals()))
00219

00243

00247         """
00248         return self._tp.rpc('job_status', _del_self(locals()))

00288     ## Returns an array of pool objects.
00289     # @param    self            The this pointer
00290     # @param    search_key      Search key
00291     # @param    search_value    Search value
00292     # @param    flags           Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00293     # @returns An array of pool objects.
00294     @_return_requires([Pool])
00295     def pools(self, search_key=None, search_value=None, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00296         """
00297         Returns an array of pool objects.  Pools are used in both block and
00298         file system interfaces, thus the reason they are in the base class.
00299         """
00300         _check_search_key(search_key, Pool.SUPPORTED_SEARCH_KEYS)
00301         return self._tp.rpc('pools', _del_self(locals()))
00302 
00303     ## Returns an array of system objects.
00304     # @param    self    The this pointer
00305     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00306     # @returns An array of system objects.
00307     @_return_requires([System])
00308     def systems(self, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00309         """
00310         Returns an array of system objects.  System information is used to
00311         distinguish resources from on storage array to another when the plug=in
00312         supports the ability to have more than one array managed by it
00313         """
00314         return self._tp.rpc('systems', _del_self(locals()))
00315 
00316     ## Register a user/password for the specified initiator for CHAP
00317     #  authentication.
00318     # Note: If you pass an empty user and password the expected behavior is to
00319     #       remove any authentication for the specified initiator.
00320     # @param    self            The this pointer
00321     # @param    init_id         The initiator ID
00322     # @param    in_user         User for inbound CHAP
00323     # @param    in_password     Password for inbound CHAP
00324     # @param    out_user        Outbound username
00325     # @param    out_password    Outbound password
00326     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00327     # @returns None on success, throws LsmError on errors.
00328     @_return_requires(None)
00329     def iscsi_chap_auth(self, init_id, in_user, in_password,
00330                         out_user, out_password, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00331         """
00332         Register a user/password for the specified initiator for CHAP
00333         authentication.
00334         """
00335         AccessGroup.initiator_id_verify(init_id,
00336                                         AccessGroup.INIT_TYPE_ISCSI_IQN,
00337                                         raise_exception=True)
00338         return self._tp.rpc('iscsi_chap_auth', _del_self(locals()))
00339 
00340     ## Returns an array of volume objects
00341     # @param    self            The this pointer

00354     ## Creates a volume
00355     # @param    self            The this pointer
00356     # @param    pool            The pool object to allocate storage from
00357     # @param    volume_name     The human text name for the volume
00358     # @param    size_bytes      Size of the volume in bytes
00359     # @param    provisioning    How the volume is to be provisioned
00360     # @param    flags           Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00361     # @returns  A tuple (job_id, new volume), when one is None the other is
00362     #           valid.
00363     @_return_requires(unicode, Volume)
00364     def volume_create(self, pool, volume_name, size_bytes, provisioning,
00365                       flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00366         """
00367         Creates a volume, given a pool, volume name, size and provisioning
00368 
00369         returns a tuple (job_id, new volume)
00370         Note: Tuple return values are mutually exclusive, when one
00371         is None the other must be valid.
00372         """
00373         return self._tp.rpc('volume_create', _del_self(locals()))
00374

00428     ## Replicates a portion of a volume to itself or another volume.
00429     # @param    self    The this pointer
00430     # @param    rep_type    Replication type
00431     #                       (enumeration, see common.data.Volume)
00432     # @param    volume_src  The volume src to replicate from
00433     # @param    volume_dest The volume dest to replicate to
00434     # @param    ranges      An array of Block range objects
00435     #                       @see lsm.common.data.BlockRange
00436     # @param    flags       Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00437     # @returns Job id or None when completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00438     @_return_requires(unicode)
00439     def volume_replicate_range(self, rep_type, volume_src, volume_dest, ranges,
00440                                flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00441         """
00442         Replicates a portion of a volume to itself or another volume.  The src,
00443         dest and number of blocks values change with vendor, call
00444         volume_replicate_range_block_size to get block unit size.
00445 
00446         Returns Job id or None when completed, else raises LsmError on errors.
00447         """
00448         return self._tp.rpc('volume_replicate_range', _del_self(locals()))

00535     ## Returns a list of access group objects

00550     ## Creates an access a group with the specified initiator in it.
00551     # @param    self                The this pointer
00552     # @param    name                The initiator group name
00553     # @param    init_id             Initiator id
00554     # @param    init_type           Type of initiator (Enumeration)
00555     # @param    system              Which system to create this group on
00556     # @param    flags               Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00557     # @returns AccessGroup on success, else raises LsmError
00558     @_return_requires(AccessGroup)
00559     def access_group_create(self, name, init_id, init_type, system,
00560                             flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00561         """
00562         Creates an access group and add the specified initiator id,
00563         init_type and desired access.
00564         """
00565         init_type, init_id = AccessGroup.initiator_id_verify(
00566             init_id, init_type, raise_exception=True)[1:]
00567         return self._tp.rpc('access_group_create', _del_self(locals()))
00568 
00569     ## Deletes an access group.
00570     # @param    self            The this pointer
00571     # @param    access_group    The access group to delete
00572     # @param    flags           Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00573     # @returns None on success, throws LsmError on errors.
00574     @_return_requires(None)
00575     def access_group_delete(self, access_group, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00576         """
00577         Deletes an access group
00578         """
00579         return self._tp.rpc('access_group_delete', _del_self(locals()))
00580 
00581     ## Adds an initiator to an access group
00582     # @param    self            The this pointer
00583     # @param    access_group    Group to add initiator to
00584     # @param    init_id         Initiators id
00585     # @param    init_type       Initiator id type (enumeration)
00586     # @param    flags           Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00587     # @returns None on success, throws LsmError on errors.
00588     @_return_requires(AccessGroup)
00589     def access_group_initiator_add(self, access_group, init_id, init_type,
00590                                    flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00591         """
00592         Adds an initiator to an access group
00593         """
00594         init_type, init_id = AccessGroup.initiator_id_verify(
00595             init_id, init_type, raise_exception=True)[1:]
00596         return self._tp.rpc('access_group_initiator_add', _del_self(locals()))
00597

00607                                       flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00608         """
00609         Deletes an initiator from an access group
00610         """
00611         init_id = AccessGroup.initiator_id_verify(init_id, None,
00612                                                   raise_exception=True)[2]
00613         return self._tp.rpc('access_group_initiator_delete',
00614                             _del_self(locals()))

00645     ## Checks to see if a volume has child dependencies.

00648     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00649     # @returns True or False
00650     @_return_requires(bool)
00651     def volume_child_dependency(self, volume, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00652         """
00653         Returns True if this volume has other volumes which are dependant on
00654         it. Implies that this volume cannot be deleted or possibly modified
00655         because it would affect its children.
00656         """
00657         return self._tp.rpc('volume_child_dependency', _del_self(locals()))
00658 
00659     ## Removes any child dependency.
00660     # @param    self    The this pointer
00661     # @param    volume  The volume to remove dependencies for
00662     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00663     # @returns None if complete, else job id.
00664     @_return_requires(unicode)
00665     def volume_child_dependency_rm(self, volume, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00666         """
00667         If this volume has child dependency, this method call will fully
00668         replicate the blocks removing the relationship between them.  This
00669         should return None (success) if volume_child_dependency would return
00670         False.
00671 
00672         Note:  This operation could take a very long time depending on the size
00673         of the volume and the number of child dependencies.
00674 
00675         Returns None if complete else job id, raises LsmError on errors.
00676         """
00677         return self._tp.rpc('volume_child_dependency_rm', _del_self(locals()))
00678

00835     ## Reverts a snapshot
00836     # @param    self            The this pointer
00837     # @param    fs              The file system object to restore snapshot for
00838     # @param    snapshot        The snapshot file to restore back too
00839     # @param    files           The specific files to restore
00840     # @param    restore_files   Individual files to restore
00841     # @param    all_files       Set to True if all files should be restored
00842     #                           back
00843     # @param    flags           Reserved for future use, must be zero.
00844     # @return None on success, else job id
00845     @_return_requires(unicode)
00846     def fs_snapshot_restore(self, fs, snapshot, files, restore_files,
00847                             all_files=False, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00848         """
00849         WARNING: Destructive!
00850 
00851         Reverts a file-system or just the specified files from the snapshot.
00852         If a list of files is supplied but the array cannot restore just them
00853         then the operation will fail with an LsmError raised.  If files == None
00854         and all_files = True then all files on the file-system are restored.
00855 
00856         Restore_file if None none must be the same length as files with each
00857         index in each list referring to the associated file.
00858 
00859         Returns None on success, else job id, LsmError exception on error
00860         """
00861         return self._tp.rpc('fs_snapshot_restore', _del_self(locals()))
00862

00885     def fs_child_dependency_rm(self, fs, files, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00886         """

00893         of the filesystem and the number of child dependencies.

00895         Returns None if completed, else job id.  Raises LsmError on errors.
00896         """
00897         return self._tp.rpc('fs_child_dependency_rm', _del_self(locals()))
00898

00959     ## Returns a list of target ports

00972         return self._tp.rpc('target_ports', _del_self(locals()))
00973 
00974     ## Returns the RAID information of certain volume
00975     # @param    self    The this pointer
00976     # @param    volume  The volume to retrieve RAID information for
00977     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero
00978     # @returns [raid_type, strip_size, disk_count, min_io_size, opt_io_size],
00979     #           else raises LsmError
00980     @_return_requires([int, int, int, int, int])
00981     def volume_raid_info(self, volume, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
00982         """Query the RAID information of certain volume.
00983 
00984         New in version 1.2.
00985 
00986         Query the RAID type, strip size, extents count, minimum I/O size,
00987         optimal I/O size of given volume.
00988 
00989         This method requires this capability:
00990             lsm.Capabilities.VOLUME_RAID_INFO
00991 
00992         Args:
00993             volume (Volume object): Volume to query
00994             flags (int): Reserved for future use. Should be set as
00995                 lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD
00996         Returns:
00997             [raid_type, strip_size, disk_count, min_io_size, opt_io_size]
00998 
00999             raid_type (int): RAID Type of requested volume.
01000                 Could be one of these values:
01001                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID0
01002                         Stripe
01003                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID1
01004                         Two disks Mirror
01005                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID3
01006                         Byte-level striping with dedicated parity
01007                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID4
01008                         Block-level striping with dedicated parity
01009                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID5
01010                         Block-level striping with distributed parity
01011                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID6
01012                         Block-level striping with two distributed parities,
01013                         aka, RAID-DP
01014                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID10
01015                         Stripe of mirrors
01016                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID15
01017                         Parity of mirrors
01018                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID16
01019                         Dual parity of mirrors
01020                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID50
01021                         Stripe of parities
01022                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID60
01023                         Stripe of dual parities
01024                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID51
01025                         Mirror of parities
01026                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID61
01027                         Mirror of dual parities
01028                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_JBOD
01029                         Just bunch of disks, no parity, no striping.
01030                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_UNKNOWN
01031                         The plugin failed to detect the volume's RAID type.
01032                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_MIXED
01033                         This volume contains multiple RAID settings.
01034                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_OTHER
01035                         Vendor specific RAID type
01036             strip_size(int): The size of strip on each disk or other storage
01037                 extent.
01038                 For RAID1/JBOD, it should be set as sector size.
01039                 If plugin failed to detect strip size, it should be set
01040                 as Volume.STRIP_SIZE_UNKNOWN(0).
01041             disk_count(int): The count of disks used for assembling the RAID
01042                 group(s) where this volume allocated from.
01043                 For any RAID system using the slice of disk, this value
01044                 indicate how many disk slices are used for the RAID.
01045                 For exmaple, on LVM RAID, the 'disk_count' here indicate the
01046                 count of PVs used for certain volume.
01047                 Another example, on EMC VMAX, the 'disk_count' here indicate
01048                 how many hyper volumes are used for this volume.
01049                 For any RAID system using remote LUN for data storing, each
01050                 remote LUN should be count as a disk.
01051                 If the plugin failed to detect disk_count, it should be set
01052                 as Volume.DISK_COUNT_UNKNOWN(0).
01053             min_io_size(int): The minimum I/O size, device preferred I/O
01054                 size for random I/O. Any I/O size not equal to a multiple
01055                 of this value may get significant speed penalty.
01056                 Normally it refers to strip size of each disk(extent).
01057                 If plugin failed to detect min_io_size, it should try these
01058                 values in the sequence of:
01059                 logical sector size -> physical sector size ->
01060                 Volume.MIN_IO_SIZE_UNKNOWN(0).
01061             opt_io_size(int): The optimal I/O size, device preferred I/O
01062                 size for sequential I/O. Normally it refers to RAID group
01063                 stripe size.
01064                 If plugin failed to detect opt_io_size, it should be set
01065                 to Volume.OPT_IO_SIZE_UNKNOWN(0).
01066         Raises:
01067             LsmError:
01068                 ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT
01069                     No support.
01070         """
01071         return self._tp.rpc('volume_raid_info', _del_self(locals()))
01072 
01073     ## Query the membership information of specified pool
01074     # @param    self    The this pointer
01075     # @param    pool    The pool to query
01076     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero
01077     # @returns  [raid_type, member_type, [member_ids]], lsmError on error
01078     @_return_requires([int, int, [unicode]])
01079     def pool_member_info(self, pool, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
01080         """
01081         lsm.Client.pool_member_info(self, pool, flags=lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD)
01082 
01083         Version:
01084             1.2
01085         Usage:
01086             Query the membership information of certain pool:
01087                 RAID type, member type and member ids.
01088             Currently, LibStorageMgmt supports two types of pool:
01089                 * Sub-pool -- Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_POOL
01090                     Pool space is allocated from parent pool.
01091                     Example:
01092                         * NetApp ONTAP volume
01093 
01094                 * Disk RAID pool -- Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_DISK
01095                     Pool is a RAID group assembled by disks.
01096                     Example:
01097                         * LSI MegaRAID disk group
01098                         * EMC VNX pool
01099                         * NetApp ONTAP aggregate
01100         Parameters:
01101             pool (lsm.Pool object)
01102                 Pool to query
01103             flags (int)
01104                 Optional. Reserved for future use.
01105                 Should be set as lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD.
01106         Returns:
01107             [raid_type, member_type, member_ids]
01108 
01109             raid_type (int)
01110                 RAID Type of requested pool.
01111                     Could be one of these values:
01112                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID0
01113                             Stripe
01114                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID1
01115                             Two disks Mirror
01116                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID3
01117                             Byte-level striping with dedicated parity
01118                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID4
01119                             Block-level striping with dedicated parity
01120                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID5
01121                             Block-level striping with distributed parity
01122                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID6
01123                             Block-level striping with two distributed parities,
01124                             aka, RAID-DP
01125                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID10
01126                             Stripe of mirrors
01127                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID15
01128                             Parity of mirrors
01129                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID16
01130                             Dual parity of mirrors
01131                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID50
01132                             Stripe of parities Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID60
01133                             Stripe of dual parities
01134                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID51
01135                             Mirror of parities
01136                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID61
01137                             Mirror of dual parities
01138                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_JBOD
01139                             Just bunch of disks, no parity, no striping.
01140                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_UNKNOWN
01141                             The plugin failed to detect the volume's RAID type.
01142                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_MIXED
01143                             This pool contains multiple RAID settings.
01144                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_OTHER
01145                             Vendor specific RAID type
01146             member_type (int)
01147                 Could be one of these values:
01148                     Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_POOL
01149                         Current pool(also known as sub-pool) is allocated from
01150                         other pool(parent pool). The 'raid_type' will set to
01151                         RAID_TYPE_OTHER unless certain RAID system support RAID
01152                         using space of parent pools.
01153                     Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_DISK
01154                         Pool is created from RAID group using whole disks.
01155                     Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_OTHER
01156                         Vendor specific RAID member type.
01157                     Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_UNKNOWN
01158                         Plugin failed to detect the RAID member type.
01159             member_ids (list of strings)
01160                 When 'member_type' is Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_POOL,
01161                 the 'member_ids' will contain a list of parent Pool IDs.
01162                 When 'member_type' is Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_DISK,
01163                 the 'member_ids' will contain a list of disk IDs.
01164                 When 'member_type' is Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_OTHER or
01165                 Pool.MEMBER_TYPE_UNKNOWN, the member_ids should be an empty
01166                 list.
01167         SpecialExceptions:
01168             LsmError
01169                 ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT
01170                 ErrorNumber.NOT_FOUND_POOL
01171         Capability:
01172             lsm.Capabilities.POOL_MEMBER_INFO
01173         """
01174         return self._tp.rpc('pool_member_info', _del_self(locals()))
01175 
01176     ## Queries all the supported RAID types and stripe sizes which could be
01177     #  used for input into volume_raid_create
01178     # @param    self    The this pointer
01179     # @param    system  System (raid) card to query
01180     # @param    flags   Reserved for future use, must be zero
01181     # @returns  [raid_types, strip_sizes], lsmError on error
01182     @_return_requires([[int], [int]])
01183     def volume_raid_create_cap_get(self, system, flags=FLAG_RSVD):
01184         """
01185         lsm.Client.volume_raid_create_cap_get(
01186             self, system, flags=lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD)
01187 
01188         Version:
01189             1.2
01190         Usage:
01191             This method is dedicated to local hardware RAID cards.
01192             Query out all supported RAID types and strip sizes which could
01193             be used by lsm.Client.volume_raid_create() method.
01194         Parameters:
01195             system (lsm.System)
01196                 Instance of lsm.System
01197             flags (int)
01198                 Optional. Reserved for future use.
01199                 Should be set as lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD.
01200         Returns:
01201             [raid_types, strip_sizes]
01202                 raid_types ([int])
01203                     List of integer, possible values are:
01204                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID0
01205                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID1
01206                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID5
01207                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID6
01208                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID10
01209                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID50
01210                         Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID60
01211                 strip_sizes ([int])
01212                     List of integer. Stripe size in bytes.
01213         SpecialExceptions:
01214             LsmError
01215                 lsm.ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT
01216                     Method not supported.
01217         Sample:
01218             lsm_client = lsm.Client('sim://')
01219             lsm_sys = lsm_client.systems()[0]
01220             disks = lsm_client.disks(
01221                 search_key='system_id', search_value=lsm_sys.id)
01222 
01223             free_disks = [d for d in disks if d.status == Disk.STATUS_FREE]
01224             supported_raid_types, supported_strip_sizes = \
01225                 lsm_client.volume_raid_create_cap_get(lsm_sys)
01226             new_vol = lsm_client.volume_raid_create(
01227                 'test_volume_raid_create', supported_raid_types[0],
01228                 free_disks, supported_strip_sizes[0])
01229 
01230         Capability:
01231             lsm.Capabilities.VOLUME_CREATE_RAID
01232                 This method is mandatory when volume_raid_create() is
01233                 supported.
01234         """
01235         return self._tp.rpc('volume_raid_create_cap_get', _del_self(locals()))
01236 
01237     ## Create a disk RAID pool and allocate entire storage space to new volume
01238     # @param    self            The this pointer
01239     # @param    name            Name of the raid to be created
01240     # @param    raid_type       The raid type (enumerated) of the raid group
01241     # @param    disks           List of disk objects to use
01242     # @param    strip_size      Strip size in bytes
01243     # @param    flags           Flags
01244     # @returns  the newly created volume, lsmError on errors
01245     @_return_requires(Volume)
01246     def volume_raid_create(self, name, raid_type, disks, strip_size,
01247                            flags=FLAG_RSVD):
01248         """
01249         lsm.Client.volume_raid_create(self, name, raid_type, disks,
01250                                       strip_size, flags=lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD)
01251 
01252         Version:
01253             1.2
01254         Usage:
01255             This method is dedicated to local hardware RAID cards.
01256             Create a disk RAID pool and allocate entire storage space to
01257             new volume using requested volume name.
01258             When dealing with RAID10, 50 or 60, the first half part of
01259             'disks' will be located in one bottom layer RAID group.
01260             The new volume and new pool will created within the same system
01261             of provided disks.
01262             This method does not allow duplicate call, when duplicate call
01263             was issued, LsmError with ErrorNumber.DISK_NOT_FREE will be raise.
01264             User should check disk.status for Disk.STATUS_FREE before
01265             invoking this method.
01266         Parameters:
01267             name (string)
01268                 The name for new volume.
01269                 The requested volume name might be ignored due to restriction
01270                 of hardware RAID vendors.
01271                 The pool name will be automatically choosed by plugin.
01272             raid_type (int)
01273                 The RAID type for the RAID group, possible values are:
01274                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID0
01275                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID1
01276                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID5
01277                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID6
01278                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID10
01279                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID15
01280                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID16
01281                     Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID50
01282                 Please check volume_raid_create_cap_get() returns to get
01283                 supported all raid types of current hardware RAID card.
01284             disks ([lsm.Disks,])
01285                 A list of lsm.Disk objects. Free disks used for new RAID group.
01286             strip_size (int)
01287                 The size in bytes of strip.
01288                 When setting strip_size to Volume.VCR_STRIP_SIZE_DEFAULT, it
01289                 allow hardware RAID cards to choose their default value.
01290                 Please use volume_raid_create_cap_get() method to get all
01291                 supported strip size of current hardware RAID card.
01292                 The Volume.VCR_STRIP_SIZE_DEFAULT is always supported when
01293                 lsm.Capabilities.VOLUME_CREATE_RAID is supported.
01294             flags (int)
01295                 Optional. Reserved for future use.
01296                 Should be set as lsm.Client.FLAG_RSVD.
01297         Returns:
01298             lsm.Volume
01299                 The lsm.Volume object for newly created volume.
01300         SpecialExceptions:
01301             LsmError
01302                 lsm.ErrorNumber.NO_SUPPORT
01303                     Method not supported or RAID type not supported.
01304                 lsm.ErrorNumber.DISK_NOT_FREE
01305                     Disk is not in Disk.STATUS_FREE status.
01306                 lsm.ErrorNumber.NOT_FOUND_DISK
01307                     Disk not found
01308                 lsm.ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT
01309                     1. Invalid input argument data.
01310                     2. Disks are not from the same system.
01311                     3. Disks are not from the same enclosure.
01312                     4. Invalid strip_size.
01313                     5. Disk count are meet the minimum requirement:
01314                         RAID1: len(disks) == 2
01315                         RAID5: len(disks) >= 3
01316                         RAID6: len(disks) >= 4
01317                         RAID10: len(disks) % 2 == 0 and len(disks) >= 4
01318                         RAID50: len(disks) % 2 == 0 and len(disks) >= 6
01319                         RAID60: len(disks) % 2 == 0 and len(disks) >= 8
01320                 lsm.ErrorNumber.NAME_CONFLICT
01321                     Requested name is already be used by other volume.
01322         Sample:
01323             lsm_client = lsm.Client('sim://')
01324             disks = lsm_client.disks()
01325             free_disks = [d for d in disks if d.status == Disk.STATUS_FREE]
01326             new_vol = lsm_client.volume_raid_create(
01327                 'raid0_vol1', Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID0, free_disks)
01328         Capability:
01329             lsm.Capabilities.VOLUME_CREATE_RAID
01330                 Indicate current system support volume_raid_create() method.
01331                 At least one RAID type should be supported.
01332                 The strip_size == Volume.VCR_STRIP_SIZE_DEFAULT is supported.
01333         """
01334         if len(disks) == 0:
01335             raise LsmError(
01336                 ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01337                 "Illegal input disks argument: no disk included")
01338 
01339         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID1 and len(disks) != 2:
01340             raise LsmError(
01341                 ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01342                 "Illegal input disks argument: RAID 1 only allow 2 disks")
01343 
01344         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID5 and len(disks) < 3:
01345             raise LsmError(
01346                 ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01347                 "Illegal input disks argument: RAID 5 require 3 or more disks")
01348 
01349         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID6 and len(disks) < 4:
01350             raise LsmError(
01351                 ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01352                 "Illegal input disks argument: RAID 6 require 4 or more disks")
01353 
01354         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID10:
01355             if len(disks) % 2 or len(disks) < 4:
01356                 raise LsmError(
01357                     ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01358                     "Illegal input disks argument: "
01359                     "RAID 10 require even disks count and 4 or more disks")
01360 
01361         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID50:
01362             if len(disks) % 2 or len(disks) < 6:
01363                 raise LsmError(
01364                     ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01365                     "Illegal input disks argument: "
01366                     "RAID 50 require even disks count and 6 or more disks")
01367 
01368         if raid_type == Volume.RAID_TYPE_RAID60:
01369             if len(disks) % 2 or len(disks) < 8:
01370                 raise LsmError(
01371                     ErrorNumber.INVALID_ARGUMENT,
01372                     "Illegal input disks argument: "
01373                     "RAID 60 require even disks count and 8 or more disks")
01374 
01375         return self._tp.rpc('volume_raid_create', _del_self(locals()))
Generated on 9 Jul 2015 for libStorageMgmt by  1.6.1
